p: The SARS-CoV-2, previously known as 2019-nCoV, is a single-stranded RNA (ssRNA) betacoronavirus, responsible for a severe pathological condition (Guarner, 2020). The COVID-19 is expanding rapidly as compared with previous coronaviruses (SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV) with the absence of therapeutic agents (Heymann et al., 2020; Zhang & Liu, 2020). On January 2020, the International Health Regulations Emergency Committee of the World Health Organization declared the outbreak as ‘public health emergency’ in responding to SARS-COVID-19.
